meanings.definition: Resembling dough in texture or consistency.
meanings.sent1: The cake batter was so doughlike that it stuck to the spoon.
meanings.sent2: The playdough felt doughlike in my hands.
meanings.sent3: The pillow was so doughlike that it seemed like a giant marshmallow.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as soft and doughlike as freshly kneaded bread.
meanings.sent5: The clouds looked fluffy and doughlike against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: Having a consistency similar to that of dough.
meanings.sent1: The clay was so doughlike that it was easy to mold.
meanings.sent2: The slime was pleasantly doughlike to touch.
meanings.sent3: The snow was so doughlike that we could make snowballs easily.
meanings.sent4: His handshake was firm yet doughlike, like a gentle squeeze.
meanings.sent5: The mud was thick and doughlike, making it hard to walk through.
